snippet: The women, both American citizens, wanted to detonate a device in the country and had been communicating with Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula, said a complaint unsealed Thursday.
abstract: Queens women Noelle Velentzas and Asia Siddiqui are charged with planning to build bomb, in plot revealed by undercover investigation of several months; women reportedly communicated with Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula and watched videos made by Islamic State.

byline.contributor: Al Baker and Rebecca White contributed reporting, and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The women, both American citizens, wanted to detonate a device in the country and had been communicating with Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula, said a complaint unsealed Thursday.

headline.main: Two Women in Queens Are Charged With a Bomb Plot
headline.print_headline: Two Women in Queens Are Charged With a Bomb Plot

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
